com.gemalto.idp.mobile.authentication.mode.biometric

Interface BiometricAuthenticationCallbacks


  • public interface BiometricAuthenticationCallbacks
    This interface gives an application maker the capability of using the following biometric authentication process and reports the results to the user.
    Since:
    5.4.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAuthenticationError(int errorCode, CharSequence errString)
      This callback function is called if the biometric authentication fails with an unrecoverable error but the authentication operation has completed.
      void onAuthenticationFailed()
      This callback function is called if a biometric is read but is not recognized (for example, a wrong finger is placed on the sensor).
      void onAuthenticationHelp(int helpCode, CharSequence helpString)
      This callback function is called if a recoverable error occurs during the authentication process.
      void onAuthenticationSucceeded()
      This callback function is called if the authentication of the biometric against the enrolled biometrics is successful - the biometric is recognized.
      void onError(IdpException e)
      This callback function is called if the biometric(fingerprint, face or iris) is not correctly configured or an internal cryptographic error occurs.
      void onSuccess(BiometricAuthInput biometricAuthInput)
      This callback function is called if: a user is successfully authenticated using biometric(fingerprint, face or iris) and an object that represents a biometric data used for OTP computation is initialized successfully The user can now use the authenticated biometric Authentication Input.

    • Method Detail

      • onSuccess

        void onSuccess(BiometricAuthInput biometricAuthInput)
        This callback function is called if:
        • a user is successfully authenticated using biometric(fingerprint, face or iris)
        • and an object that represents a biometric data used for OTP computation is initialized successfully
        The user can now use the authenticated biometric Authentication Input. For example, OTP computation.
        Parameters:
        biometricAuthInput - represents the authenticated biometric authentication input object.

      • onError

        void onError(IdpException e)
        This callback function is called if the biometric(fingerprint, face or iris) is not correctly configured or an internal cryptographic error occurs.
        Parameters:
        e - an exception object indicating biometric authentication problem. An application behavior can be determined according to an exception type.

      • onAuthenticationError

        void onAuthenticationError(int errorCode,
                           CharSequence errString)
        This callback function is called if the biometric authentication fails with an unrecoverable error but the authentication operation has completed. For example, when the user has tried with an invalid biometric consecutively. For the list of error codes and descriptions, please see:
        Parameters:
        errorCode - the error code of the failed operation.
        errString - the description of the error.
        See Also:
        Section 'Constants' Please note that once a user has reached the maximum number of failed attempts permitted by the system (for example, 5 failed attempts), the sensor will be locked out for about 30 Seconds depending on the OS version and manufacturer before the next attempt can be performed.

      • onAuthenticationHelp

        void onAuthenticationHelp(int helpCode,
                          CharSequence helpString)
        This callback function is called if a recoverable error occurs during the authentication process. An error can be presented to the user using a dialog fragment. It gives the user a chance of re-authenticating. For example, a finger is removed from a sensor too quickly. For the list of error codes and descriptions, please see:
        Parameters:
        helpCode - code of message
        helpString - help string
        See Also:
        Section 'Constants'

      • onAuthenticationSucceeded

        void onAuthenticationSucceeded()
        This callback function is called if the authentication of the biometric against the enrolled biometrics is successful - the biometric is recognized.

      • onAuthenticationFailed

        void onAuthenticationFailed()
        This callback function is called if a biometric is read but is not recognized (for example, a wrong finger is placed on the sensor). In such cases, an error can be presented to a user through dialog fragment.
